text: I love the length.

This has been my go to tool for years for my naturally curly hair. Only problem is that it is made so cheaply now, it does not last. The plastic teeth break off very easily. I ordered a new one and it happened even faster this time and the name on the handle wore off after a few weeks. When it has all the teeth, it works great but does not last long at all.

I LOVED this curling iron brush when I got it exactly one year ago today.  I loved this curling iron every time I used it over this past year.  However, as of today, I no longer love it, I don't even like it.  I believe that a curling iron used no more than 3 or 4 times a week should last more than exactly one year to the day.
Great as long as you use the guard. If you try to get closer, all it does is pull the hair. Ouch!

I was really excited to get this, but unfortunately it doesn't get hot enough to style my hair. My hair is very thick, and at the top heat setting, It barely curled it. It would probably be great for someone with fine hair or someone who has delicate hair that can't take high heat.
Not only does it exceed my expectations but 3 people visited over the weekend, noticed it and wanted to know where they could get one. Of course I gave them your info on Amazon. Thank you

I recieve this item this day .and the problem is it can't turn on while charging that's the problem anyways the item's cheaply made abviously of the price . Well that's why I gave 3 star of this product .

Works well on mobilizing excess arm fat; tightening of the skin is less dramatic.
It may be hard on the skin if you have any skin senstivity.  My daughter's skin remains very red after using it for a few weeks.
Great product. Came exactly as ordered in excellent condition. Fits my merkur razor and new brush perfectly.
This was the third one of these that I have bought from them.  1 at home, 1 at work and now this one for my son.
This hair trimmer is okay, it is not very strong and it is of low quality.  I recommend you spend an extra $10 and get the remmington, it is stronger

Guess I should have paid more attention to the negative reviews.  I was hoping, since it is a corded model, that it would have a powerfull motor.  I have a older Remington rechargable (which is broken which is why I ordered this) that is faster.  So far, with new blades, it is shaving pretty good.  I have not experienced any "lift and pull".  Will be interesting to see how it is after the blades dull a bit.  Could use a longer cord as well.  Still, for $34.00 and free shipping it isn't a bad buy.
This is an A-list wannabe.  Decent scent, but not worth the $55 price tag.  Would pay $30-$40 max.
Get one, you'll love it.

I inserted some Wilkinson Swords in to my usual sampler pack rotation. One blade in each of my five most used razors for five days. Each of the five razors produced the same results with my usual technique: Razor burn, butchered face, and general redness and irritation. I removed the blades from my rotation as soon as the five day trial was up. I will not be using these again. As is with all shave products, though, your experience may vary. I have very sensitive, dry skin. Astras and Derby's work best for me. This probably isn't a bad product, just not the right one for me.
It burns, but I'm hoping that that means it's working.
does not seem to heat up to a high heat at all,not pleased with product much, bought conair after this purchase
OUCH!!!!  Not good for sensitive areas. It nips the skin.  Otherwise it is a great, sturdy product.

It's basic and to the point, you adjust it to 5 lengths and it cuts evenly.  I'm kinda pissed that I lost the adjustment piece and had to buy a whole new one because just the replacement is no where online and Panasonic wants to charge you more than the original cost of the entire set.... so it gets 3 for being lame like that

The power and trimming of this razor is fine. My issue is with the plastic cover that holds in your beard trimmings. Mine falls off easy, spilling the trimmings over the floor. Also the trimmings jam in the narrow vacuum slot. If you do something like take off the cover and bang out the razor over a trashcan, you will lose the filter in the trash can. I have adapted by trimming with my finger holding the cover on, and banging it out while holding onto the filter.
It's a must for the guy that uses a safety razor. Besides, your brush will last ages with its hairs down. I love it.
Made with cheap plastic
I don't really see nothing so special about it compare to the others,cuz my husband has to do his beard more than once to get what he s looking for,
Fits both my Viking Chieftain and Perfecto pure badger brush, though the Chieftain doesn't sit as firmly in the stand. For the price, can't complain.
Came in fast and is very good quality. Definitely recommend.
liked it but did not fit the razor

This stand is very well made and does exactly what it's supposed to do. For whatever reason I thought it would be bigger than it actually is but it's a very good size without taking up a significant amount of counter space. This will likely be the only stand I'll ever need. Seems as through it would fit just about any razor and brush. No complaints whatsoever.
Works ok and guard gives me some peace of mind.

I have been using Norelco for over 30 years and was surprised that the quality of the shave is so poor from previous shavers. Perhaps they should rethink making them in China. This will be the last Norelco that I ever purchase.
I gave this set away.  It was too difficult for me to do my own waxing.  I can't comment on the quality of the product.
What more can I say?  It's exactly as described.  Works as you'd expect.  Excellent product at an excellent price.
ok

After reading all the great reviews about this product, I eagerly bought it.

My first time using it in the bath....it was great. In my hot bath it dissolved easily and the aromatic smell helped me clear my sinuses (I suffer with spring allergies something awful). Couldn't wait to use it again.

My second time using this, I wasn't so lucky.  Despite my hot bath water, it didn't dissolve completely. Unfortunately, I did not discover this until I was in the tub. Enough "grit" was left undissolved where I ended up in pain; it scratched my hind quarters so badly that I was actually bleeding in a few spots. Needless to say, the pain I felt from the mustard bath water, on my scratches (and few cuts, to be honest) was immense. Later that night I had to resort to having my husband apply Vitamin E to my scratches -just so I could get some relief. The next day, I am still in pain.

I'm not sure what went wrong. My bath water was sufficiently hot enough to dissolve the mustard bath. I used it one other time, with no issues. However, I am NEVER going to use this, in my bath, again. Interestingly enough, the product packaging contained no warnings, whatsoever. In hindsight, I find that strange.

If you must use it, my recommendation is to use it for a foot soak, only.
The stand is beautiful. Heavier than expected and my brush fits great. It comes inside a sturdy blue box which can be used as a gift box. Very pleased.
Husband Likes it, Just wish it came with it's own stand up holder. But it seems to work good for him.
This one works fine as far as heating but cord is aawkward and does not twirl as you use it and then it does not sit on the counter when you set it down
Beautiful little stand, holds both my razor and the brush very well.  No complaints, nothing really to add.

Works well. Smells funny. Has to be used twice daily in my experience for 3-4 days after shaving or bumps will simply reapear.  If underwear edges rubs the area it will bump up anyway.

I found that plain ol' vaseline works better without the odor or need to reaply.

Basically was it worked much much better than using nothing but i've found a better solution since.

Cons - button that pops off the top for putting different grooming cap on is right above the on/off button, and easily hit, because just as big in different shape. Should have put it on the back.
To remove the mustache trimmer to just use the blade, common when trimming, you must slide the whole trimmer assembly off, using depth level button to remove. That probably won't last long. Previous trimmer the whole head assembly came off maintaining the setting.

Pluses - decent selection of other trimmer types to replace, though ease of carrying/storing them has not been found yet.

This is the third brand I have owned and I hate it the most.  I don't want to be shaved clean by it, but it near to impossible to get it close enough to your skin to even cut close around the bikini area.  When you do it yanks and pulls and cuts you.  I will go back to the Braun Silk-pil FG1100.  For the cost and how well it works, it is a much better product.
Excellent product! Bought this as a gift for my husband and he loves it. Super quality!
messy to use, would not purchase again and only had relief for one day
Did not fit my latherwhip shaving brush or muhle razor.

Very good shaver... for a few shaves. I bought my first unit on Christmas, had it replaced due to the battery problems similar to the ones reported in other reviews here. Second unit - same problem. My idea of a good shaver (and good product in general) doesn't include dealing with the customer service, and I've had too much of it with this shaver. I was offered a third unit - c'mon...I went for a refund, these guys need to admit that there is a design flow with these units and fix it rather than keep replacing the units. I have one word for them - recall
Beautiful and well balanced holder for my new DE razor!  Great price and fast shipping too!  The packaging was also quite lovely and would make an excellent gift!
Love it!
Nope....not organic and not vegan!  There are still toxic ingredients in this product.  Not good enough for our Earth, the animals and our bodies!  Thank you for reading.  Sincerely, Dolly
to soon to tell.
Sturdy base, as I hoped, and maintains polish/shine even after occasional splash. Does not look cheap. Top screw that holds it all together stays snug. I'd buy it again even if more expensive.

This looks just like the picture, I can fit my breakfast, lunch and maybe a few snacks.  I take a lot of food to work.  The pocket is roomy enough for medication/feminine products/etc.  I have had this cooler for at least 6months now and it is still like new. The straps are durable.  I like that there is an off white color with the green, white would get dingy fast. Its easy to clean and maintain.
This trimmer didn't last more than 2 minutes.  I even tried a second set of batteries.  I'm returning it.
The product was cute and easy to use.  It arrived quickly and in perfect condition.  We used the wall decals on the window, wall and mirror.  Thank you
Looks good. Feels solid.
Sparse amount of bristles.
Works GREAT, but you MUST use the perfecto brush so it fits.
All of the teeth broke off within a month. Very disappointed. Contacted Helen of Troy and they suggested I buy a new one and did not offer any warranty information.
Great product. Well made. Excellent service and fast delivery!
love it!
Superior quality and fits my shaving brush perfectly. The weight distribution and metal material looks as great as it performs.

I'm only on day two, but my teeth seem noticably whiter, which is a shock, because my teeth are relatively white to start and it's hard to find a product that makes any difference at all. It was very painful to apply them today, the peroxide burned my gums very much to the point where they turned white near my teeth. I toughed it out though, and the pain wore down after a few minutes. I did have problems all day though, it was a constant pain in my upper and lower teeth, I'm really hoping it's just temporarily sensativity. I also recommend applying lipbalm before using, because your teeth will probably get chapped. Let's hope the pain dies down, because they seem to be working!

this is a plastic bottle i didn't know that, Im used to the glass bottles.  arrived very hot because it was a hot day in cali that day. but I don't like that its plastic because if it gets hot it will leech out chemicals into the alcohol based after shave. I'll stick to the glass bottles from now on. that my 2cents
This stand is as advertised -- it seems sturdy and looks good. It's nice to have a proper stand for my razor and brush.

I bought these a while back ago, I didn't like the results. I don't think they really work, they have a satisfactory guarantee, or your money back. I wasn't motivated to get my money back, only once I felt a stinging sensation, that was after I brushed my teeth "not recommended" yeah it says not to brush your teeth before you use this product. I did anyways and that's the only time I ever felt any stinging sensation. The product didn't do it's job, I don't think I'll buy anything from crest again related to whiting. I should have saved up my money and got my moneys worth, I'd advise you do the same. Just save a bit, to get better results else where.
This is a great stand--very easy to keep clean and it looks very nice on the counter...
A quality product that should outlast me.
It worked okay for the price but Glytone and Obagi work a lot better for me (I have fair skin with sun damage).

Basically, this is a decent product with one major flaw.
The removable head falls out of place too easily.
With barely a touch, the removable head falls into the sink or onto the floor, and the removable film seperates from the razor. Now, you must reattach the film cover to the removable head, then, place it back into the "snap" position. Once you continue to shave, the removable head falls out of place again, even if you barely apply any pressure!

Norelco needs to design a removable head that is more firm.

This is a three star product-
Only issue I have is that my lather brush does not fit properly in the stand. Other than that, this is built to last and looks good on my counter.

I too have been using Avalon Organics CoQ10 wrinkle defense serum for a long time. I am utterly dismayed that the product has been changed and the new 'formula' is absolutely nothing like the old and does nothing for me.  The original product was the best, but the new cheap reformulation is awful and must have been done purely to make moe profit.  The formula does not contain all the original ingredients that made the product so wonder all the good stuff has been removed and replaced them with less expensive ingredients. The soft and wonderful formula left my skin glowing too, the new cream, well waste of time.  The marketing angle of "more sustainable" is just a smoke screen.  It is not the same product as before. It took me years to find the original product but they have taken something really special and destroyed it, heartbreaking! In my opinion, look elsewhere, as this is not the great product it once was, all my friends who used it agree and have stopped using it.  So sad.

It does whiten your teeth, however the bottom tray doesn't stay in place - on me anyway. It kept sliding up and getting stuck together. While trying to unstick it and put it back in place, the gel kept sliding out.  The top tray was fine. I'd give it 2.5 stars since it half=worked.
Works well. Using this with the Escali badger hair brush and Merkur long-handled razor. No complaints

This is a great idea, but the execution is lacking. On the plus side the blade angle makes some trimming easier, but the plastic combs are difficult to remove, don't offer a high degree of flexibility in grooming lengths, and the shaver can only be recharged on the stand (the charger can't plug into the shaver).

But the biggest issue I have is this: If men these days are supposed to do stupid things like shave their backs, then why don't manufacturers make shavers with longer handles? As is, you practically have to be a contortionist to use the silly thing. (Or duct-tape it to a broom handle.)

If you like floss that shreds, breaks and comes in a strange configuration (part of the strands are woven white, other sections are just a thin, green "core") then this is the product for you. Bonus: if you are unfortunate enough to take the floss anywhere, say in a suitcase, the lid will promptly come off the floss container and in short order, you will have strands wended through your socks and underwear.

Not a good product. Most any super cheap dollar store floss would be better than this stuff.
Looks sharp, seems well constructed. Owned for 2-3 weeks.

The product was shipped and arrived on time. The product is sturdy and is able to hold both my Edwin Jagger best badger brush and matching EJ Mach 3 handle with no issue. The razor handle has a nice base under the blade release button, allowing a perfect fit.
Elegant and pretty for a marble bathroom
Highly recommend this stand.  It is high quality, sturdy, nice finish, enough weight to be very stable, and looks great.

I have been using this product for years and all of a sudden the last two I purchased where defective.  The bristles all break off as soon as I received the brush.  At first I thought I had a defective one.  Then I received the second one and it did the same thing.  Now I have no bristles on the wand. I would not buy this again...
Not what I remembered
I like it much better then trying to cut with scissors or using a razor.  I brought one for my sister for Christmas and she likes it too.
Unfortunately I found out that the dimension of the rod isn't right for my current style so I'm not using it regularly.  I did try it out and my one complaint is that it doesn't get very hot.
waste of money
Looks great, good quality. Can't wait to put it in my bathroom.
Half-used and broken when it arrived. Disappointed...
It is costly.
Great product, great price. Exactly as described.
It is ok.
I use this to hold my Vikings Blade razor.  Does the job.  Nice bottom.  Holds my shaving brush too.  Keeps the shaving area clear.
Expensive soap with not much scent

I ordered the Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor/Brush stand along with the  "Parker Safety Razor SYNTHETIC Bristle Shaving Brush with Blue Wood Handle" as shown in the "Frequently bought together" section on Amazon.  Pay close attention to what the ordering instructions say.  Don't order the stand before you measure the brush.  The brush is not a good fit with this stand.  It can work but the brush tilts sideways. I believed the frequently bought together claim thinking it would provide a good fit with the brush.  It fits fine with my razor.  I may be sending the stand back to Amazon.  Otherwise the stand is all that is promised.  The brush I am keeping!

I used this in my hair, but it seemed to make it tangled and nappy. Sprayed it on my face and besides smelling like roses, it was no more effective than plain tap water. Wasn't really sure what to expect when I tried it though.....
Does what I need it to, looks nice and holds my shaving gear.
Currently awaiting refund. The cord arrived with wiring exposed, and I didn't realize until after I started using it. Very dangerous flaw.

I think I bought this product to shave my man parts. You know, chest, back, etc. Ultimately I lost the foil blade and they are crazy expensive to replace. Even before I lost the blade, I came to realize that men are supposed to be hairy. As long as you don't let it get too wild, I think you're ok.

It's ineffective, it cuts you, and it went in the trash. I know this isn't a lengthy and descriptive review on the ways it didn't work, the cuts it inflicted, and/pr what sort of trashcan it met its end in, but I think in this case, less is more. Don't waste your money.

I like the aftershave. I like the classic aroma. BUT: are you kidding me? Who designed the bottle? It is the worst bottle and cap combination ever. You cannot use this product without spilling some. I am telling you, this container was scientifically developed with one purpose in mind: to spill over your counter. It's an ultimate spilling machine.
Very sturdy. I would give it higher marks but most of my brushes don't fit unless I put them in where the bristles attach.

If you've been reading any of the reviews here lately you will know the 8000 series foil/cutterblock combo has been replaced with a new combo now called the series 5 Combi 51S.  You will receive this replacement even if the picture on the product page shows "8000 series" as it has been discontinued for over a year.  Braun merged the replacement for the 8000 series (Activator) with the 360 Complete.  This new foil/cutterblock is garbage!  The cutterblock has wide blades, as opposed to the thinner blades of the original 8000 series, which pull your stubble and take MANY passes over your face to shave.  They are prone to premature failure and I have gone through 3(THREE) of these in 6 months!  (I bought one and two were free through Braun after complaining).  All the free replacements in the world weren't making the shaving experience any better.  I longed for the days when my Activator 8595 cut smooth, close, and comfortably.  After all, this shaver had been my favorite for 6 years so far!  I was very close to dumping the whole shaver and moving on when I happened across a reviewer on Amazon who suggested using the 7000 series replacement foil/cutterblock in his review.  It worked PERFECTLY!  The 7000 series replacement looks just like the much coveted original on my 8595 Activator - down to the thinner cutting blades!  It didn't pull my stubble, it cut smooth as butter, and was comfortable: JUST LIKE NEW!  I'd like to thank the original reviewer (James L. Walls "sixtoe") for the very good advice.
sOLID QUALITY ITEM. i'M ENJOYING IT.
Sturdy construction and made of good quality materials. It's just perfect for the straight razor I just bought. I will recommend this product to a friend.
I'm so disappointed to find this product containing Methylparaben. Can they remove it? Maybe this isn't the real product? The one my sister has states NO PARABENS.
Very nice.
I am sorry I bought this product. Takes 15 minutes to heat up. Who has that kind of time? Save your money.
Solid stand, haven't had any problems with brushes or razers fitting
The galaxy design looks really cool and nice. I'm impressed! Great product. The strap is thick and the set of zippers are durable!

It is a really pretty color but when I put it on it didn't look right. I ended up using my cheap drugstore blush over it. Maybe this particular color was not the right one for me. I still don't think it is worth what I paid for it. I had always heard that it was the best blush ever. I wasn't that impressed. Sorry :(
This product just does not do the job. The guides are not calibrated correctly and the trimmer took turns being razor sharp to incredibly dull. Not worth the money.
Looks like it was used, does not get as hot as a normal one of this brand

Great.  It holds my razor and shaving cream brush.  What else to say?
Good price and seems to be a great product. Looks good next to the sink. No more fumbling through bathroom drawer for the razor.

This is my third Norelco beard trimmer and it's a huge disappointment. I'd send it back today if I could.

Shoddy construction, imprecise cut, hard to assemble and reassemble. Other posters with negative comments are on target with this product.

I would happily go back to one of their older products without all the "new and improved" junk in this model.

Consider yourself warned.
For as much publicity Helen of Troy hair products gets, this is a cheaply made curling iron.  Not happy or impressed.
For some reason this one smelled nothing like the other patchouli Zumbar's i purchased.. overpowered and just didn't smell the same.. was highly disappointed in this bar.. :/
these did not seem to work as well for my husband as the one's we'd ordered before, they pulled at his wiskers...

This inexpensive razor and brush stand will serve it's function generally.  It seems to be well constructed and should last a good long time.  I like that the base has a pad to help keep the stand from sliding around on the counter.  My one complaint is that the brush holder is a little too narrow and is a very tight fit on the brush handle.  Not a deal breaker, but...well you will have to judge.  I don't know if this is normal or just undersized.

I tried this product on a simple loose cap despite many poor reviews.  I should have paid attention.  This stuff is useless.  I am an engineer with over 40 years of experience, including the use of adhesives.  I followed the preparation and application directions flawlessly.  I even kept pressure on for an hour (very uncomfortable).  The crown fell off immediately after.  Save yourself some grief and a little money and use something else.

It gave me a few breakouts on my cheeks so I am not that impressed.  I know there is supposed to be a purging stage but I really don't believe that a good products make you worse before they make you better.  Good products correct the wrongs and improve the skin with continual use.
It worked great while it lasted. Within a month the tip fell off, and there is no way to put it back on. The iron is useless after that.
Simple but does the job.
Great stand, can be used with long handle razors without problems
Elegant design, well crafted and extremely functional.  It's beautiful enough to leave out on a bathroom vanity.  Very pleased.
Very attractive, stylish and functional addition to my bathroom counter top. It does the job and adds a touch of sophistication.

Very nice stand. Holds the razor and brush and has a nice gleam to it. Do note that this is for a standard size brush handle! I do have a few brushes (Stirling badger for instance) that while they do fit, are hanging on more of a balancing act rather than flush in the stand. Not a problem as long as you're aware!

he's used it for about a year and still going.  good one.  I got this and the blades and set etc as a xmas gift.  my husband never shaved this method before but i thought it was classy and fun.  HE LOVES IT!  It is a great manly type of gift and he say's he'll never go back to shaving the other way again.  Yay me!

I've been through two of these so far.  First one lasted about 13 months, then stopped taking a charge (it was the shaver, not the charger).  Second one lasted 6 months and the button became stuck and you could not turn if off or recharge it, so it sat in the bathroom sink bouncing around for 8 hours until the juice ran out.  They say they have a 2 year warranty but it's not worth the postage to send the stupid thing back.

When it works, it gives a very effective and painless groom everywhere, really liked the ease of using and the result from it.  Blades seem to last about 7 months before they need to be changed, using it once a week.

The Philips Norelco 6843XL is one of the best cordless shavers I have used

(I have used 3 others). So why only 3 stars ? because the shave is not

as smooth or clean as a razor.

Still the 6843XL is not a bad buy. for those days where a quick shave

is all you want - when you don't have the time or want to fuss with foam,

water, and cuts... It is rechargeable and good for at least 1-2 weeks of

quick shaves, gives a reasonable (but not smooth) shave, and cleans

reasonably easy.
The teeth on the brush have broken off in spots. Only used a little. The plastic body seem very light and flimsy.

I have had several of these brushes with each one going down in quality. The one I recently took on an international trip melted and a brand new one didn't even get hot....sending it back to manufacturer.
Product was good, but felt like I was paying a subscription fee for using my razor Braun. I'm much happier now with my Norelco razor. Free usage. The Braun razor was quite loud as well.

I was looking for a dual-purpose rose water and I have realized, after the fact, that what I really need is a true hydrosol. Since I read the consistently high ratings for this brand at the time, though, and the budget friendly price, I decided to go with this one. I received it yesterday and used it last night in my face cleaning routine. The smell is okay. Maybe I just don't like roses as much as the next person. It was by no means offensive, but I personally wouldn't want to wear a perfume that smelled like this. I transferred this into a fine-mist spray bottle and spritzed it on after cleaning my face and neck and applying Hyaluronic Acid, and before my moisturizer. Since I have several steps in fighting the melasma, wrinkles, and adult acne, my face gets dry by the time I'm ready to put on my moisturizer. I will definitely continue to use it, as it does seem to keep the dryness at bay while I go through my routine. It is refreshing on the skin and I had no negative reaction to it.
For the dual-purpose part: I had Lasik eye surgery 10 years ago and I've been suffering from extremely dry eyes for about two years. I wanted something without all the synthetic ingredients that all the OTC drops have. Many people have commented that rose water drops are very good for dry eyes. Turns out, this rose water is just distilled water with rose essential oil added. I need to do some further research, but I don't think this is going to work. For skin moisturizing purposes, though, it's fits the bill.

Very steady and perfect fit for the razor.  No wobbles even when holding just the razor.  4-stars only because the brush did not fit in the prongs.  Still deciding whether to make a grove in the brush or to attempt to spread the prongs a little - I recall some others did mention this as a possibility.

This item is great if you want to trim short hair cuts, good value for a great price. Lots of accessories, even a nose hair trimer! BUT... MAKE SURE YOU CHARGE IT COMPLETELY BEFORE USE! I thought that if I used it with the power adapter, it would cut even if it was not fully charged. Fact is that, even if you have the power adapter plugged in to the wall, if it is not fully charged you will NOT be able to cut. This sux if you are in the middle of a haircut and you run out of juice. (happened to me) and so I had to wait with hair patches till the thing was charged again to be able to finish the cut. Maybe I should have read the instructions, but I've had other rechargable battery clippers in the past and as long as you had it plugged it would work even if it was not fully charged.

This is a big flaw for me and that's why I take away 2 stars. Other than that the machine is great, Cipper sizes are very good, stable, convenient/all in one. Good product that could be better if the battery/power options were improved.

This thing is a piece of junk.  The rubber bottom, while it helps to keep the unit from sliding around, has the added caveat of remaining wet for a long period of time after a shave.  How do you dry it?  I don't know.  Perhaps by turning it on its side until it air dries.  In  the meantime, what then to do with one's razor and, more importantly, one's shaving brush which must be stored with the bristles facing downward so the knot does not get ruined from getting soaked?  Also, this unit is rather tall, so it will not easily fit into a cabinet recess or on a cabinet shelf.  I guess the unit is okay as long as you can leave it out, but I would still recommend placing it on  a dry paper towel after shaving to prevent mildew from forming and, worse, spreading.  Legionnaire's, anyone?

Before I purchased this item, I read the mostly favorable reviews and got pretty excited, but for around $35.00 I was cautiously optimistic.  After charging the unit I tried it out for the first time, and found it took some time to get used to, for two reasons.
1. Getting the angle right so it trims well is tricky
2. Getting comfortable using a device that looks like this around your private areas is unsettling initially, but I've used it 3 times now and haven't had a nick or cut yet.

This product does what its name implies, it "grooms" you, it doesn't shave you.  What I mean by this is, you will get a much closer shave by using a manual (facial) razor and shaving cream/gel.

It does feel sturdy, however the head can be a little large for getting certain areas.  All in all a nice unit, but don't expect a straight-edge shave with it.
It's exactly what I needed. My wife suggested I purchase it. It's very good quality. Buy it now!

Here is an update from Nov. 2015 -

Unfortunately, it applies to the seller of this product, not to the product itself. I bought it at the beginning of October, and now 5 weeks later it still has not arrived from the UK to LA, CA. No tracking info, nothing to do about it, but to ask for a refund and never buy again.

I purchased this product for the first time only recently, after doing some online research. I was looking for a healthy alternative to a brand that I used for almost a decade. I have about 20% gray hair, more so on my temples, and my natural hair color is dark brown. The Medium Brown 4N by Tints of Nature seemed to be the best match, so I gave it a try. I had nothing to lose but gray hair.

When I got the package, I read everything on the box and in the instructions, just to make sure I'm not missing any warning, as we all know, these things always come with all sorts of warnings. Though, I did not do the allergy test 48 hrs ahead as I never had any allergy issues before, even with brands that are known to be less safe. And I did not regret it, because I had no issues at all. It's been now 5 days since I used it and I am completely fine.

As for the product, I instantly liked it. The color smells very nice, it does not have the typical chemical/toxic smell to it, and I did not even have to turn on the fan in my bathroom. The preparation time is just as with any other brand, as there are two bottles that need to be mixed well, and you are good to start with your journey. The mixed color paste is just thick enough that it does not drip from your hair, and still, you can run your comb through your hair if you need to. I also like that it is made of the certified organic ingredients, and that it has the least amount of the toxic ingredients, which they have to use in order for it to fully cover your gray hair. Be aware that this is not a 100% non-toxic/organic product, however, it is the least toxic permanent hair color that I could find on the market.

In addition, it is made in the UK, and to my knowledge, they need to comply with the much stricter EU safety standards, unlike US manufacturers. That fact alone gives me a piece of mind, as FDA has not changed their laws about the beauty products and their safety since the 70s.

And the most important thing, the hair color came out beautifully. It has a warm tone of the dark brown shade, and it fully covered all my grays. My hair looks shiny and natural. The gray portion got a very slight tint of a dark brown with golden undertones, but they are still very well covered. No one would be able to tell that those were gray hairs at some point. The previous brand that I used to use would give me a very dark brown with black undertone, and it was a bit too dark. I love this product, it is the safest I could find, its packaging is made out of recycled materials, and they use organic ingredients, among other things.

The only thing I don't like is its price. It is about double of what other similar products cost and I have not seen it in any store in CA. Which means, there is shipping time to include in your wait, so I am about to order myself another box.

I highly recommend this brand, and this is after using hair colors on and off for about past 20 years. I started experimenting in my teens, and by now I consider myself an amateur-pro, if there is such a thing.

This is a well made nice stand but when you search for "Mach 3 Razor Stand" on Amazon this is the first result... the problem is if you try to put a Mach 3 razor on it it falls right off and there's no way to get it to stay on.  So if you're looking for a something to hold your cartridge razor this may not work depending on how its shaped.
Don't smell rosy

I have used nail polish thinner (other brands) before and know how they work. This product doesn't work at all!!! I added a few drops of this thinner only when my nail polish started to get thick. After shaking and checking the nail polish, it was still very thick so I added more drops. Still not working so I added few more drops and checked again. Well, just look at the pictures. The thinner was completely separated from the nail polish and was sitting on top of the nail polish. Now my nail polish is so gooey and completely ruined.
Great product. Delivered quickly, as promised. It is sturdy and well-made. It was purchased as a gift and was really appreciated by the recipient.
The trimmer didn't cut as nicely as previous products.  I also didn't pay attention that it is battery operated, which lugs in comparison to electric charging (that is my fault, not theirs).
Very nicely made! Real weight to it and it is very well balanced.
The expiration date was October 2010!!!! They don't make this product anymore, and it should not be sold to anyone!
Very nice stand, good finish, heavy base with soft padding. Fits my Merkur 38c with long handle and Plisoft brush perfectly. It also looks good on the counter.
So far, I haven't found any nail polish I use that this thins. Very disappointed about its effects on a gloppy bottles of OPI and Kleancolor.
Too expensive ... I use the container to now hold the cleaning solution I make for pennies.  Use isopropyl alcohol and a few drops of baby oil.  Check the Internet.

I just got into wet shaving.  I decided to invest a little money into it and buy some nicer stuff than just the basic starter kit.  I purchased the Merkur Long Handle Safety Razor and the Escali Badger Hair brush and this stand to hold them.  It is a basic stand and it looks nice and feels sturdy.  The base is pretty heavy, which keeps it upright when the brush and razor are resting on it.  The Perfect Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand hold the Escali and Merkur perfectly.  Since both of these items are very popular, this stand is a nice complement to both items.  The only down side to the stand I see is if you drip water on it, it will get water spots but it can easily be cleaned.

I bought this for my gf so she wouldn't have to spend so much money at a salon.

FIRST OFF: We DIDN'T get everything that this kit is suppose to come with. The collars weren't in the kit, neither were the smaller set of muslin strips.

SECOND: The creme wax wasn't great. It's sticky, messy and "for sensitive skin" is not the greatest. However all skin types are different. It worked fine for her but on me was not at all pleasing.

Other than these two factors, this set would have been great! My gf loves everything else about it. She loves the warmer and says it's a nice starter kit.
I always fill it up with 70% ethanol and it works very well so I don't have to buy it everytime

Despite some reviews that complain about shave brush is not fitting in this item I did not find a problem. Sure it would be nice if it worked as the photo illustrates, however as my photo illustrates,  A shave brush can in fact be hung from this dapper looking way to organize your shave kit.  This shave brush stand and razor stand is nice and sturdy, heavy and clean looking. I love it
Item received as expected, on time and without any problems
It's ok.  I expected it to be smaller to make it easier to maneuver in such a delicate area.  Unfortunately, it's about the size of a typical beard trimmer.
The beard trimmer is good but I don't care for the moustache trimmer,it was a lot better on my old one.
This trimmer works but has to be used dry. Hair clings to the plastic by static electricity. There is a little brush included for cleaning but it would be a lot easier to just rinse it off.
Good quality stand, holds my Viking razor and brush perfectly.
No spray nozzle like the picture shows,  and the scent only lasts a few minutes. It's nice otherwise.

I read several reviews before buying the product and there are people who absolutely love it and those who swear wouldn't buy again. I'll try to be as objective as possible...

Effectiveness:

The product works. It whitens my teeth after the first use, and the result became very obvious after 3 uses (as it claims), so I'm pretty satisfied.

Tray Design:

The tray fits my mouth quite well (but I have a small mouth... I even wonder how it would fit bigger mouth since the tray is kinda small.) Spreading the gel so that it fully covers the teeth isn't easy. I noticed that the top part of the teeth are whiter than the bottom (especially the bottom teeth.)

Side Effect:

The gel DOES hurt the gum. I read other reviews and people have been complaining about bleached gum. My gum didn't get bleached, it didn't turn white, but it bled!!! The part of the gum closest to the teeth turned red because of the bleeding and there's also minor peeling of the gum too. It hurt pretty bad when I brushed my teeth. The bleeding only happened the first two times... I guess my gum got used to the gel since it didn't bleed after the third time (however, still hurt a little.)

Bottom line:

It does the job. It whitens your teeth, but comes with a price... hurts your gum!

So, here's what I do:

The first two trays I used them two days in a row (like the instruction says) and on the second day, it's really painful on the gum. So I waited one day before doing the third one and my gum didn't hurt as much. I would suggest using it every other day (or you can try two days between use)... I think it helps with the tooth sensitivity (which I didn't experience as much as when I used the Crest White strip) and the painful gum.

I hope this helps.

I bought this Hummingbird Flosser kit thinking that it could do the same work that my tired and circulation restricted fingers do.  It failed in getting between even my not-so-tightly spaced teeth.  I guess I'll stick with Oral B Ultra Floss since it works.  If your teeth are very tight/close together, I would suggest that you not buy the Hummingbird flosser.

It works well for short, fine hair in just one sweep.  It takes a little more effort for anything else.  A small amount of hair clogs up the razor cutting edge pretty quickly, but it can be easily washed out with water. The overall benefit of this probably is that it does not cut off more than you want at any one sweep. The dual sided cutting head is a great advantage since it avoids a lot of contortion to get both sides of your body. It's a bit more expensive than other similar grooming razors.
It didn't really cut.

Don't use this product. I used it in Nov 2016 and had a burning sensation. Because the look was so nice I used it again in Jan 2017. I had a severve allergic reaction to PPD. It took a week or so but my head was burning and itching. My eyes swelled, I felt dizzy at work, was weak and get very sick. I stated suspecting the dye but was not sure. Went to my doctor he told me I burnt my scalp. Still couldn't figure out what did it. I went back to Natural Grocers where I bought the product and they had no clue, no education. My mother researched the product and PPD is used in products that claim they are organic. It is a dangerous chemical. It broke down my immune system and burnt my hair follicles. Within a month I am bald. I went from nice thick hair to close to 75% bald and still shedding. It's close to 2 months and my scalp still burns. My hair slowly  fell out and then came out in clumps in the shower. We started researching. PPD is a petroleum and use in oil and gas. To make tires... look it up, it falls under several chemical names.
